title: What is architecture, and why is it important? - Quora

response.answer_text: An architect is a qualified or a professional individual who is well-versed in the planning, designing as well as overseeing the construction of a building. An architect is a person who is qualified to design a building, furniture, etc. Besides design, an architect is instrumental in overseeing the construction and the ornamentation of the buildings. An architect designs the buildings taking their environmental and aesthetic aspects into consideration. Architecture is important because: It is good for economics. The best of the architecture designs are affordable and continue to drive economic flow.It brings in aesthetics but architecture goes beyond just aesthetics.It integrates comfort, maximum and productive use of the available space.It improves the quality of life.A good architecture brings a sense of balance into your life.A good architecture design makes lives more efficient.A good architecture improves productivity.Architecture meets the needs of the owner.It reflects the tradition and culture.Architecture is concerned with practicality and endurance.

architecture is living space — opposed to sculpture, which is just occupying space. so, an interior is necessary for the start of an architecture. living space is constructed according to need. a hunter can build a quick shelter out of sticks or leaves or even logs. he’s moving on, emptying the neighborhood of game, doesn’t come back. so, need defines the project — need to have a cheap house is one of the big needs. and, houses are designed by architects. architects are also responsible for the interior layout of the rooms, and the convenience of movement and a sense of livability — too cramped or not, too awkward or not: where should the bathroom go? then there’s buildings. need for efficient space and light ( wright’s johnson’s wax building in milwaukee. ) but, also, need to project power and capability — all those skyscrapers.
